results.title: Three "I"s: a trio of personal films about Sweden by two Canadians and one Swede
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, Mort Ransen, Eric M Nilsson, John Kemeny, Wolf Koenig, Joseph Koenig, Swedish Institute for Cultural Relations and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film trilogy presenting impressions of Sweden by two Canadians and one Swede: Mort Ransen and Martin Duckworth of the National Film Board, and Swedish director Eric M. Nilsson. The film is composed of three films: “A Place for everything” - Eric Nilsson takes up the contrasts in the well-ordered Swedish society - order versus spontaneity; individual desires set against collective needs; subordinares vis-a-vis superiors. The young Swedes interviewed make a plea for independence, imagination and the discussion of existing conditions. “Falling from ladders” - Simply by putting about 20 Swedish men, women and young people in front of his camera and having them read aloud from the Statistical Year Book, filmmaker Mort Ransen has recorded a wide range of impressions of Sweden’s economic and social existence. Quotations vary from the whole gamut of exports and imports, marriages formed or dissolved, to the number of people who fall from ladders annually. (Award: Philadelphia) “Passing through Sweden” - A film critic of one of Sweden’s daily newspapers says of this film by Martin Duckworth, “Never before have I seen a film that so intensely interpreted the experience of Swedish surroundings…an ‘atmospheric film’ in which all the expression is in the pictures.”
results.title_for_label: Three “I”s: a trio of personal films about Sweden by two Canadians and one Swede
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Duckworth, Mort Ransen, Eric M Nilsson, John Kemeny, Wolf Koenig, Joseph Koenig, Swedish Institute for Cultural Relations and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Threads of Ireland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
This program looks at the traditions and culture brought to Australia by the Irish Catholic convicts, and the way in which the Irish influence is still present in modern Australia. Explores the history of Australian writing, music and religion which have an Irish influence.

results.title: Threads
results.creator_credit: BBC, Western World, Publishing and Broadcasting and Mick Jackson
results.brief_description: It’s a normal Thursday in Sheffield when East and West stumble into war and Britain is devastated by 200 megatons of nuclear explosive. This chilling story tells the story of a nuclear strike on Britain. Through the eyes of two Sheffield families, we witness the immediate after effects of the attack - the shock, grief, radiation sickness, hypothermia and starvation. In the following months, hideous injuries remain untreated, looters are shot on sight, food supplies run out and many die in the intense cold of the nuclear winter. Thirteen years on a depopulated Britain living below subsistence level is revealed - a devastated economy where money has no value, crops fail through lack of pesticides, fuel and machinery, and a brutalised postwar generation grows up stunted mentally, physically and emotionally. The fragile fibres that hold society together - the threads - have been completely destroyed and there is no outside aid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: BBC, Western World, Publishing and Broadcasting and Mick Jackson

results.title: Thousands cheer
results.creator_credit: Joe Pasternak, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and George Sidney
results.brief_description: A professional singer who is also a Colonel’s daughter (Kathryn Grayson), decides to follow in her father’s footsteps and join him by entertaining the troops he has been assigned to train. On the platform prior to departure, she meets Private Eddy Marsh (Gene Kelly) who impulsively kisses her in the belief that she is one of the women farewelling the troops. After the train has left the two meet again, and Kathryn jokingly says that she followed the private on board to propose to him. When Eddy goes to her cabin to discuss the issue, he finds Kathryn there with her father, and demands to be transferred to another division, the Army Air Corps. On the advice from friends that the quickest way to get a transfer is to ingratiate himself with the Colonel’s daughter, Eddy soon develops a relationship with her. Eddy’s attentions suit Kathryn too, as she uses the ruse of saying that she’s fallen in love to try and bring her mother to see her, and be united with her ex-husband - Kathryn’s father. Eddy takes Kathryn to see the Flying Corbinos, a trapeze act in which Eddie used to be the star, but had to abandon when forced into National Service. Eddy and Kathryn fall in love, and Kathryn gets her wish of her mother being united with her father, the only problem is she’s come to break up her daughter and the man she now loves. The film culminates in a dazzling array of stars from the MGM payroll including Judy Garland, Mickey Rooney, Red Skelton, Lucille Ball, Eleanor Powell, Ann Sothern, Lena Horn, June Allyson and Donna Reed, as well as Eddy rejoining the Corbino family for a performance for the troops. Cast also includes Mary Astor, John Boles, Ben Blue, Frances Rafferty and Mary Elliott.

results.title: Thoughts on the future with George McRobie
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, ONF | NFB and Roger Hart
results.brief_description: George McRobie, from Britain’s Intermediate Technology Group, and environmental specialists from Canadian universities, government and industry, discuss changes they foresee in the treatment of the Earth’s resources and the responsibility that falls to technology in making the world a better place to live. Some ecology-protective progress is illustrated in the film by engineers, and much more is promised for the future.

results.title: Thou shalt not...kill
results.brief_description: Thou Shalt Not Kill is a black and white cut-out animation. A priest and larrikan ride together as passengers on a train through the countryside. The larrikans’ pranks and vibrant antics play on the priests patience to test his self-control and moral beliefs…especially the one about ‘Thou Shalt Not Kill’.

results.title: Those wild wild mushrooms
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rex Tasker, F Whitman Trecartin and Art Makosinski
results.brief_description: A happy-go-lucky film that should appeal to anyone interested in eating and stocking an inexpensive source of food. The information is built into a comic story about two experienced mushroom pickers and one novice, and their respective perambulations through the woods. Close-ups are supplemented by descriptions of the mushrooms, and a warning is issued not to pick what you can’t clearly identify, given the similarity between the poisonous and non-poisonous varieties.
